verses.esv: 31 So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.kjv: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.niv: 31 So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own, 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own? 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.esv:
2   and put a knife to your throat
    if you are given to appetite.
verses.kjv: 2 And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
verses.niv: 2 and put a knife to your throat if you are given to gluttony.

verses.esv:
20   Be not among drunkards
    or among gluttonous eaters of meat,
21   for the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty,
    and slumber will clothe them with rags.
verses.kjv: 20 Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh: 21 For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
verses.niv: 20 Do not join those who drink too much wine or gorge themselves on meat, 21 for drunkards and gluttons become poor, and drowsiness clothes them in rags.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own,
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own?
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;

verses.esv: 19 Their end is destruction, their god is their belly, and they glory in their shame, with minds set on earthly things.
verses.kjv: 19 Whose end is destruction, whose God is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.)
verses.niv: 19 Their destiny is destruction, their god is their stomach, and their glory is in their shame. Their mind is on earthly things.

verses.esv:
27   It is not good to eat much honey,
    nor is it glorious to seek one’s own glory.
verses.kjv: 27 It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.
verses.niv: 27 It is not good to eat too much honey, nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.esv: 16 Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in you?
verses.kjv: 16 Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
verses.niv: 16 Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you?

verses.esv:
14   Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed;
    save me, and I shall be saved,
    for you are my praise.
verses.kjv: 14 Heal me, O LORD, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.
verses.niv: 14 Heal me, O LORD, and I will be healed; save me and I will be saved, for you are the one I praise.

verses.esv:
7   The one who keeps the law is a son with understanding,
    but a companion of gluttons shames his father.
verses.kjv: 7 Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
verses.niv: 7 He who keeps the law is a discerning son, but a companion of gluttons disgraces his father.

verses.esv: 18 And do not get drunk with wine, for that is debauchery, but be filled with the Spirit,
verses.kjv: 18 And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
verses.niv: 18 Do not get drunk on wine, which leads to debauchery. Instead, be filled with the Spirit.

verses.esv: 21 It is good not to eat meat or drink wine or do anything that causes your brother to stumble.
verses.kjv: 21 It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.
verses.niv: 21 It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else that will cause your brother to fall.

verses.esv: 26 saying, “If you will diligently listen to the voice of the LORD your God, and do that which is right in his eyes, and give ear to his commandments and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you that I put on the Egyptians, for I am the LORD, your healer.”
verses.kjv: 26 And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that healeth thee.
verses.niv: 26 He said, "If you listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God and do what is right in his eyes, if you pay attention to his commands and keep all his decrees, I will not bring on you any of the diseases I brought on the Egyptians, for I am the LORD, who heals you."

verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ. It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
verses.kjv: 20 I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.
verses.niv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

verses.esv: 17 For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking but of righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 17 For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.
verses.niv: 17 For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking, but of righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Spirit,

verses.esv: 7 “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.kjv: 7 Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
verses.niv: 7 "Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

verses.esv: 5 Let your reasonableness be known to everyone. The Lord is at hand;
verses.kjv: 5 Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.
verses.niv: 5 Let your gentleness be evident to all. The Lord is near.

verses.esv: 33 But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.kjv: 33 But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.niv: 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.esv:
16   If you have found honey, eat only enough for you,
    lest you have your fill of it and vomit it.
verses.kjv: 16 Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
verses.niv: 16 If you find honey, eat just enough- too much of it, and you will vomit.

verses.esv: 13 No temptation has overtaken you that is not common to man. God is faithful, and he will not let you be tempted beyond your ability, but with the temptation he will also provide the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.
verses.kjv: 13 There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
verses.niv: 13 No temptation has seized you except what is common to man. And God is faithful; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, he will also provide a way out so that you can stand up under it.

verses.esv: 20 and they shall say to the elders of his city, ‘This our son is stubborn and rebellious; he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton and a drunkard.’
verses.kjv: 20 And they shall say unto the elders of his city, This our son is stubborn and rebellious, he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton, and a drunkard.
verses.niv: 20 They shall say to the elders, "This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He will not obey us. He is a profligate and a drunkard."

verses.esv: 10 The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
verses.kjv: 10 The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
verses.niv: 10 The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
